intro: Polygala vulgaris var. flavescens, commonly known as the yellow milk-vetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish or reddish flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in spicate inflorescences. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits. The species is adapted to a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, sunny habitats.
